answers.text: Texts relating to the Old Testament

qas.question: When did James Bennett Pritchard write his textbook?

context: Resorting to this verbal device, however, did not protect the "Ancient Near East" from the inroads of "the Middle East." For example, a high point in the use of "Ancient Near East" was for Biblical scholars the Ancient Near Eastern <a0_0>Texts relating to the Old Testament<a0_0/> by James Bennett Pritchard, a textbook of first edition dated <a1_0>1950<a1_0/>. The last great book written by <a2_0><a3_0>Leonard Woolley<a3_0/><a2_0/>, British archaeologist, excavator of ancient Ur and associate of T.E. Lawrence and Arthur Evans, was The Art of the Middle East, Including Persia, Mesopotamia and Palestine, published in 1961. Woolley had completed it in 1960 two weeks before his death. The geographical ranges in each case are identical.
